hanzi-su-wiki:
聾

Значения

Глухота; глухой (человек)

Мнемоника

Случай, когда «дракон 寵 на ухо 耳 наступил».

Варианты

聋
purpleculture_pinyin:
lóng
deaf
глухой
purpleculture_info:
(Simplified: 聋)
Pictophonetic: 龍 indicates the sound; 耳 (ear) conveys the meaning.
purpleculture_examples:
聾啞 [ lóng yǎ ]: deaf and dumb
聾啞人 [ lóng yǎ rén ]: a deaf mute person
purpleculture_tree:
• ⿱ Above to below
    • 龍 [ lóng ] dragon; symbol of the emperor
    • 耳 [ ěr ] ear; to hear, to hear of; handle
heisig_chinese_memo: A Chinese dragon flying overhead can cause deafness to your ears.
Kanshudo_mnemonic: the dragon's (龍) ear (耳) is deaf
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: A dragons ears are almost completely deaf from all of that noisy roaring and fire breathing, but they have great senses of smell and sight.
humanum_full_description_en:
The Oracle and Bronze inscriptions of the word " deaf " are from " ear ", " dragon " sound (interpreted from Li Xiaoding), the original meaning is that no sound can be heard.

"Shuowen": "Deaf, unheard. From the ear, the sound of the dragon." "Shi Ming. Explaining the Disease: "Deaf, the cage is like being in a cage, you can't hear it." "Guang Ya. "Shi Xun": "Deaf, deaf, and disease." Wang Niansun Shuzhen: "Deaf, deaf, and disease that cannot be heard." Handwritten documents are mostly used as the original meaning, referring to loss of hearing, "Zuo Zhuan. "The Twenty-four Years of Xi Gong": "If you don't listen to the five tones, you are deaf."

The oracle bone inscriptions are incomplete, and the meaning of the word is unknown. "Collection" 21099: "Ugly Bu... Deaf." Inscriptions on inscriptions used as a person's name.

The word " deaf " in the Warring States period refers to the deaf, "Shangbo Zhushu II. Jian 36-37 of "Rong Chengshi": "The people are suitable for resentment, malaria begins to reproduce, so there are suffocation, deafness, skin (lame), sting, gallbladder, 㾈, and Lou (fistula)." No wonder the whole sentence refers to it. The people became resentful and malaria began to develop. As a result, people who were dumb, deaf, lame, small or blind, with big necks, hunched back, and swollen necks began to increase.

Han silk script is used as the original meaning, referring to the deaf, "Mawangdui silk script. "Lao Zi Jiaben" line 112: "Five flavors make people's mouth refreshing, five tones make people deaf."
humanum_short_description_en: The Oracle and Bronze inscriptions of the word " deaf " are from " ear ", " dragon " sound (interpreted from Li Xiaoding), the original meaning is that no sound can be heard.
humanum_full_description:
「聾」字的甲骨文和金文均從「耳」，「龍」聲(從李孝定所釋)，本義為聽不到聲音。

　　《說文》：「聾，無聞也。從耳，龍聲。」《釋名．釋疾病》：「聾，籠也，如在蒙籠之內，聽不察也。」《廣雅．釋訓》：「聾、聵，疾也。」王念孫疏證：「聾、聵，皆不能聽之疾。」傳世文獻多用作本義，指失去聽力，《左傳．僖公二十四年》：「耳不聽五聲之和為聾。」

　　甲骨卜辭辭殘，字義不明。《合集》21099：「丑卜……聾。」金文用作人名，聾乍寶器鼎：「聾乍(作)寶器。」

　　戰國文字「聾」指聾子，《上博竹書二．容成氏》簡36-37：「民乃宜怨，虐疾始生，於是乎有喑、聾、皮(跛)、眇、癭、㾈、婁(瘻)始起。」全句指難怪人民因而生怨恨，瘧疾也開始產生，於是啞巴、聾子、腳瘸、一目小或一目失明、大脖子、駝背、脖子腫起的人開始多了起來。

　　漢帛書用作本義，指耳聾，《馬王堆帛書．老子甲本》第112行：「五味使人之口爽，五音使人之耳聾。」
humanum_short_description: 「聾」字的甲骨文和金文均從「耳」，「龍」聲(從李孝定所釋)，本義為聽不到聲音。

「 聾 」字的甲骨文和金文均從「 耳 」，「 龍 」聲(從李孝定所釋)，本義為聽不到聲音。 《說文》：「聾，無聞也。從耳，龍聲。」《釋名．釋疾病》：「聾，籠也，如在蒙籠之內，聽不察也。」《廣雅．釋訓》：「聾、聵，疾也。」王念孫疏證：「聾、聵，皆不能聽之疾。」傳世文獻多用作本義，指失去聽力，《左傳．僖公二十四年》：「耳不聽五聲之和為聾。」 甲骨卜辭辭殘，字義不明。《合集》21099：「丑卜……聾。」金文用作人名，聾乍寶器鼎：「聾乍(作)寶器。」 戰國文字「 聾 」指聾子，《上博竹書二．容成氏》簡36-37：「民乃宜怨，虐疾始生，於是乎有喑、聾、皮(跛)、眇、癭、㾈、婁(瘻)始起。」全句指難怪人民因而生怨恨，瘧疾也開始產生，於是啞巴、聾子、腳瘸、一目小或一目失明、大脖子、駝背、脖子腫起的人開始多了起來。 漢帛書用作本義，指耳聾，《馬王堆帛書．老子甲本》第112行：「五味使人之口爽，五音使人之耳聾。」
The Oracle and Bronze inscriptions of the word " deaf" are from " ear", " dragon" sound (interpreted from Li Xiaoding), the original meaning is that no sound can be heard. "Shuowen": "Deaf, unheard. From the ear, the sound of the dragon." "Shi Ming. Explaining the Disease: "Deaf, the cage is like being in a cage, you can't hear it." "Guang Ya. "Shi Xun": "Deaf, deaf, and disease." Wang Niansun Shuzhen: "Deaf, deaf, and disease that cannot be heard." Handwritten documents are mostly used as the original meaning, referring to loss of hearing, "Zuo Zhuan. "The Twenty-four Years of Xi Gong": "If you don't listen to the five tones, you are deaf." The oracle bone inscriptions are incomplete, and the meaning of the word is unknown. "Collection" 21099: "Ugly Bu... Deaf." Inscriptions on inscriptions used as a person's name. The word " deaf" in the Warring States period refers to the deaf, "Shangbo Zhushu II. Jian 36-37 of "Rong Chengshi": "The people are suitable for resentment, malaria begins to reproduce, so there are suffocation, deafness, skin (lame), sting, gallbladder, 㾈, and Lou (fistula)." No wonder the whole sentence refers to it. The people became resentful and malaria began to develop. As a result, people who were dumb, deaf, lame, small or blind, with big necks, hunched back, and swollen necks began to increase. Han silk script is used as the original meaning, referring to the deaf, "Mawangdui silk script. "Lao Zi Jiaben" line 112: "Five flavors make people's mouth refreshing, five tones make people deaf."

聾字的基本解释

聾
lóng
见“聋”。

聾字的汉语字典释义

[①]［lóng］
［《廣韻》盧紅切，平東，來。］
“聋1”的繁体字。
(1)听觉失灵或闭塞。
(2)愚昧；不明事理。

聾字的康熙字典解释

【未集中】【耳字部】　聾； 康熙笔画：22； 页码：页970第26
【唐韻】盧紅切【集韻】【正韻】盧東切，?音籠。【說文】無聞也。【釋名】籠也。如在蒙籠之內，不可察也。【左傳·僖二十六年】耳不聽五聲之和爲聾。又【宣十四年】鄭昭宋聾。【註】聾，闇也。【禮·王制】瘖聾跛躃斷者。【疏】聾謂耳不聞聲。　又葱聾，獸名。【山海經】符禺之山，其獸多蔥聾，其狀如羊而赤鬛。【註】葱聾，如羊，黑首赤鬛。　又【韻補】叶盧黃切，音郞。【易林】遠視無光，不知靑黃。黈纊塞耳，使君闇聾。

考證：〔【左傳·僖二十六年】耳不聽五聲之和曰聾。〕　謹照原文曰聾改爲聾。

暂无。

Kangxi dictionary interpretation of words
[Not concentrated] [Ear Word Department] 　 Deaf; Kangxi Strokes: 22; Page Number: Page 970 26
[Tang Yun] Lu Hongqie [Ji Yun] [Zheng Yun] Lu Dongqie, sound cage. [Said the text] Nothing is heard. 【Release name】Cage also. If you are in a cage, you can't see it. [Zuo Zhuan·Xi Twenty-Six Years] If you don’t listen to the sum of the five tones, you are deaf. Also [Xuan 14 years] Zheng Zhao Song Deaf. [Note] Deaf, dark also. 【Rite·Royal System】Those who are deaf, lame and severe. 【Sparse】Deaf means hearing nothing.　It's onion and deaf, the name of the animal. [Shanhaijing] The mountain of Fuyu, its beasts are mostly onion and deaf, and it looks like a sheep with red sharks. [Note] Onion and deaf, like a sheep, black-headed and red-shouldered.　[Rhyme Supplement] Ye Lu Huangqie, Yin Yin. [Yi Lin] Farsightedness and lack of light, I don't know the yellowness. He plugs his ears and makes the king darkly deaf. Textual research: [[Zuo Zhuan·Xi Twenty-Six Years] Hearing the Five Tones of Hearing and Saying Deaf. 〕 　 I would like to say deaf to deaf according to the original text.
